job.title: Packaging Operator
job.description:

  • General manual labor tasks including loading, unloading, lifting, and moving materials

job.title: Design Engineer – Electrical
job.description:
• Location: Canton, MS
  • Type:Direct Hire
  • Job#45034

Resource Employment Solutions is working with the one of the top-rated engineering companies to work for in 2022. Our client, being a consulting firm is recognized as a specialist in power system design and analysis. They are anchored by veteran power system design leaders and a growing team of control system professional engineers. They are looking for an Electrical Design Engineer to join their growing team. This Electrical Engineer will prepare plans and specifications for construction packages using design software and in conjunction with other project team members. 

RELOCATION PACKAGE AVAILABLE

Responsibilities of Electrical Design Engineer :

  • Develops design proposals and estimated cost of construction for completed designs.
  • Responsible for reviewing/checking the designs, specifications, and costs estimates of electrical engineers that are part of our current team.
  • Assists in the review of vendor/contractor submittals and Requests for Information (RFIs) to bring product design from engineering phase to completed construction.
  • Monitor and report the status of all current design projects.

Qualifications of Electrical Design Engineer :

  • Bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering from an ABET accredited university.
  • Experience in low and high voltage power distribution, lightning protection, lighting.
  • Experience with AutoCAD required, Windchill, and SKM is a plus.

job.title: Material Handler (1st Shift) Sun to Wed
job.description:
• Location:Swedesboro, NJ
  • Type:Contract to Hire
  • Job#45045

A Material Handler, or Warehouse Associate, Handles, moves, and Stores various non-hazardous and hazardous materials within a warehouse. Their main duties include loading and unloading different transport items, recording inventory statuses, and making sure deliveries properly match purchase orders. Fundamental computer skills including typing and using a mouse.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Verify incoming and outgoing unit counts and unit condition
  • Maintain satisfactory Quality performance levels
  • Package, unpackage, sort, stage, and prepare units for production
  • Data entry to systems via PC and RF handheld devices
  • Perform tasks in a high-speed, high-volume environment
  • Put away and pull equipment and/or parts
  • Maintain and clean, organized workstation
  • Other duties as assigned

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Excellent attention to detail and accuracy
  • Identify the basic components of a computer (Keyboard, mouse, screen, etc.)
  • Strong verbal communication skills
  • Ability to work independently and also within a team
  • Excellent organizational skills
  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs
  • Previous experience working in a high-volume distribution, manufacturing, technical service (i.e. testing and repair) or forward logistics operation a plus

SHIFT AND PAY:

  • 1st Shift: Sunday to Wednesday
  • 7:00am – 3:30pm 
  • $14.25 / hour

job.title: Fabrication Associate
job.description:
• Location:Dublin, OH
  • Type:Contract to Hire
  • Job#45043

Workers engage in fabrication of sheet metal products.

RESPONSIBILITIES OF FABRICATION ASSOCIATE:

  • Operation of various equipment, including but not limited to, spot welders, presses, and shearers to fabricate sheet metal products within required specification.
  • Lifts, positions, and removes sheet metal and/or sheet metal parts from machines or stock to assist in fabrication.
  • Loads, stacks, and transports raw material, tools, dies, and products by hand or fork truck.
  • Utilization of overhead crane and slings to transport dies.
  • Cleans, grinds, and scrapes metal prior to fabricating, welding, painting, or shipping.
  • Performs quantitative and qualitative inspection of parts, as needed. May require utilization of blueprints and/or other operational documentation.
  • Picks up and trucks scrap from work areas.
  • Cleans work area, machines, tools, and equipment.
  • More experienced associates may perform the following duties:
  • Manually “hand work” fabricated metal parts to specification, utilizing, for example, hammers and grinders.
  • Develop and plan sequences of operations.
  • Sets up fabricating machines such as press brakes, presses, shearers, plasma and flame cutters, drill presses, cutters, and bandsaws.
  • Designs and constructs templates and fixtures for utilization in sheet metal fabrication.

REQUIREMENTS OF FABRICATION ASSOCIATE:

  • Education and/or Experience High school diploma or general education degree (GED); or one to three years’ related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

SHIFT:

  • Monday – Friday
  • 8:00am – 4:30pm

job.title: Production Manager
job.description:
• Location:City of Industry, CA
  • Type:Direct Hire
  • Job#45042

PRODUCTION MANAGER – City of Industry, CA 

The Production Manager is responsible for all production operations at a plant including manufacturing, shipping, scheduling, and maintenance. The Production Manager is responsible for effectively leading a production team in the efficient and safe production of corrugated products. As a member of the plant management team, the Production Manager is responsible for evaluating opportunities to improve overall plant performance and profitability. 

RESPONSIBILITIES OF A PRODUCTION MANAGER: 

  • Set the strategic direction and momentum for the manufacturing function in the plant. 
  • Oversee, plan, and implement strategy to optimize the effective utilization of workforce, materials & machinery. 
  • Engage in employee development activities, make recommendations on employee hire, promotion, and disciplinary action. 
  • Assure an even flow of work through all manufacturing functions to meet production goals and minimize unscheduled downtime. 
  • Oversee the hiring, training, promotions, and performance evaluation of employees. 
  • Analyze production performance, identify opportunities, make recommendations for process and equipment improvement, establish, and execute goals. 
  • Assist the upper management in developing business plans and evaluating and recommending capital projects to ensure the plant remains profitable and competitive. 

REQUIREMENTS OF A PRODUCITON MANAGER: 

  • Education equivalent to a bachelor’s degree in engineering or business required. 
  • Ten (10) years of previous experience in corrugated manufacturing industry. 
  • Seven (7) years’ previous experience in a supervisory capacity at a corrugated manufacturing facility. 
  • Established knowledge of corrugated and packaging manufacturing machinery, concepts, practices, and procedures including continual improvement processes and safety practices. 
  • Previous experience in coaching, training, teambuilding, performance development, and conflict resolution. 

Resource is an Equal Opportunity Employer EEO AA M/F/Vet/Disability and a drug free workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristics protected by law. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, Resource complies with the laws and regulations outlined in the EEO is The Law poster

job.title: Production Assembler 2nd shift
job.description:
• Location:Valencia, CA
  • Type:Contract to Hire
  • Job#45036

Production Assemblers needed for one of the largest manufacturers of rubber products for the Aerospace industry located in Valencia CA.

RESPONSIBILITIES OF A PRODUCTION ASSEMBLER:

  • Remove molded product from mandrels.
  • Daily Inspection of parts coming out of molding press
  • Trimming/cutting parts per work instructions
  • Clean and inspect parts and post cure
  • Part marking and packaging parts
  • Count and label parts
  • Some computer work may be needed 
  • Assembling parts with detail orientated

QUALIFICATIONSOF A PRODUCTION ASSEMBLER:

  • Communication skills, ability to escalate issues
  • Ability to read blueprints
  • Tool knowledge to identify/utilize appropriate tools for the task (scissors, blades, clippers, slitting fixtures, etc.)
  • Ability to read and understand work orders & SMI Notes

REQUIREMENTSOF A PRODUCTION ASSEMBLER:

  • Must have a High School Diploma or GED
  • Must be able to understand work orders and read blueprints
  • Must speak, read, write and understand English
  • Able to life and pull at least 40 pounds
  • Must be able to work with silicone and organic products
  • Must comply with company’s housekeeping policy
  • Must comply with company’s safety rules

SHIFT AND PAYOF A PRODUCTION ASSEMBLER:

  • Mon – Fri 3:00 pm to 11:00 pm, with OT!! 
  • Sat – Mandatory OT 1-3 hours or as needed. 
  • $17.25 to start 
  • Experience is a plus

Our growing company is searching for dedicated candidates for an Onsite Supervisor position in our Mooresville location.

SUMMARY OF AN ONSITE SUPERVISOR:
A Site Supervisor oversees the work operations ensuring the efficiency of workflow and safety of the workforce. The tasks of a Site Supervisor primarily revolve around conducting inspections, assessing risks, managing and evaluating workers.

job.title: Senior Cost Accountant
job.description:
• Location:Vernon, CA
  • Type:Direct Hire
  • Job#45010
Our client is seeking a Senior CostAccountant and is looking to fill this position immediately. This is a Direct Hire Position.

The Senior Cost Accountant will provide timely and detailed analytical reports regarding costs, manufacturing operations, and labor operations to ensure efficiency.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Provides reports on cost roll, multi-level bills of materials, direct and indirect labor, overhead rates and absorption, product cost development.
  • Identifies opportunities to improve profitability of the company 
  • Helps guide financial decisions by participating in establishing, monitoring, and enforcing policies and procedures.
  • Performs journal entries and account reconciliations for assigned areas
  • Participates in monitoring and confirming financial condition by participating in audits and providing information to external auditors.

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Minimum Bachelor’s degree in accounting or finance
  • At least 5 years of cost accounting experience
  • *Food industry experience preferred.
  • Proven ability to utilize a system of key metrics, financial measurements and manufacturing cost analysis
  • Experience with an ERP system – Preferably SAP by Design, Oracle or similar
Pay Rate:
  • $40+/hr, Dependent On Experience

Shift Details:

  • M – F 8:00am-5:00pm (on-site)

job.title: Project Manager
job.description:
• Location:Beloit, WI
  • Type:Contract to Hire
  • Job#44992

Do you have an entrepreneurial spirit and a creative mindset? Do you want to join an innovative, world-class team that helps protect our freedom? Consider a career with us! Where we value continuous personal improvement for all team members. Experience a work environment where everyone thrives.

Resource Employment Solutions is hiring a REMOTE Project Manager. The Ideal Candidate would have a background in the Maritime defense industry and or Oil and Energy Industries.

ROLE SUMMARY OF PROJECT MANAGER:

The Project Manager is responsible for planning, managing, executing, and controlling assigned projects, ensuring that Client objectives are obtained. He or she oversees budgeting, quality control, scheduling, planning and coordination of construction activities and prepares monthly financial reports. The Project Manager is fully responsible for all aspects of the project, from start to finish.

EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF PROJECT MANAGER:

Coordinate/execute the project schedule and budget, resulting in an efficient profitable project

Work in a cooperative, respectful manner that enhances the work of others and promotes a team environment

REQUIREMENTS OF PROJECT MANAGER:

  • Lead the planning and execution of a project or projects.
  • Facilitate a timely project startup process and ensure a good hand off between Get Work and Do Work
  • Define project tasks and resource requirements
  • Review and obtain required permits in advance of work
  • Review job budgets, buyout, submittals, submit Requests for Information (RFI) and (ROI)
  • Attend/lead pre-construction meetings and other meetings
  • Review production reports and quantity tracking
  • Submit Change Order pricing and approval in a timely manner
  • Attend weekly onsite Project Manager Meetings
  • Conduct PowerPoint Presentations to internal executives on projects
  • Perform job site visits
  • Provide direction and support to project team
  • Prepare monthly Pay Applications
  • Prepare monthly Cost to Complete (CTC) reports and attend monthly financial review meeting
  • Assist Superintendents and field personnel with problem solving issues

QUALIFICATIONS OF PROJECT MANAGER:

  • Two (2) to five (5) years’ work experience in a Project Manager capacity
  • Familiar with Accounting and Job Costing
  • Able to think and understand strategically
  • Strong planning and organizing skills
  • Problem solving and decision capabilities
  • Strong customer and results orientation
  • Able to interact effectively at all levels
  • Team environment oriented
  • Strong verbal and written communications skills around PowerPoint presentations
  • Expert computer skills with proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint
  • Bachelor’s degree
  • Experience in the Maritime Defense industry, Oil and Energy, or Military preferred.

Resource is an Equal Opportunity Employer EEO AA M/F/Vet/Disability and a drug free workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristics protected by law. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, Resource complies with the laws and regulations outlined in the EEO is The Law poster

  • Type:Direct Hire
  • Job#44902

Our client is currently seeking a Maintenance Mechanic. This is a Direct Hire position that our client is looking to fill immediately. 

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Able to proficiently diagnose, repair, replace and/or overhaul all mechanical components for numerous types of equipment to include but not limited to production equipment (Blenders, Grinders, Pumps, Fillers, Sealers, Cappers & Conveyors), packaging equipment (Metal detectors, Printers, Case packers & Case tapers), electrically operated equipment, variable speed controllers, hydraulic equipment, air compressors, air handlers, HVAC and related software programs, etc
  • Possess mechanical and troubleshooting knowledge and skills including, but not limited to, mechanical, pneumatic, hydraulic and electrical operation, process and control systems including both building electrical and machine electrical panels.
  • Assist with project and system startups and operational checkouts on systems including configuration, wiring, calibration, grounding and power testing
  • Provides emergency/unscheduled repairs of production equipment during production and performs scheduled maintenance repairs of production and facility equipment during machine service

REQUIREMENTS:

  • High School diploma or equivalent
  • Technical Training (electrical & mechanical)
  • Related experience in food processing or production and/or packaging machinery.
  • Must be flexible to work weekends and other shifts as needed.
  • Able to lift up to 50 lbs, carry tools and supplies, kneel, stoop, bend and stand for periods of time.
  • Experience with VFFS Packaging Machinery Preferred

  • $26+/hr (Depending on Experience)

job.title: Shipping and Receiving Associate
job.description:
• Location:Dublin, OH
  • Type:Contract to Hire
  • Job#44971

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Compares identifying information and counts, weighs, or measures items of incoming and outgoing shipments to verify information against bills of lading, invoices, orders, or other records.
  • Also verifies and keeps records on incoming and outgoing shipments and prepares items for shipment.
  • Directs movement of shipments from shipping and receiving platform to storage and work areas.
  • Prepares bills of lading.
  • Affixes shipping labels on packed cartons or stencils identifying shipping information on cartons.
  • Assembles wooden or cardboard containers or selects pre-assembled containers.
  • Confers with supervisors of other departments to coordinate flow of materials or products.
  • Reviews records for accuracy of information and compliance with established procedures, and to determine adequacy of stock levels
  • Requisitions containers and other supplies for delivery to workstations.
  • Verifies or prepares records such as routing slips, material requisitions, and job orders.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • High school diploma or general education degree (GED); or one to three months related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl; talk or hear and taste or smell. The employee must regularly lift and /or move up to 50 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 100 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.
  • Computer Skills Computer Skills To perform this job successfully, an individual should have knowledge of MRP, email, spreadsheet, and word processing software.
  • One needs to be able to effectively operate within and navigate electronic databases and data entry systems.

job.title: Logistics Coordinator
job.description:
• Location:Grove City , OH
  • Type:Contract to Hire
  • Job#44965

Resource Employment Solutions has recently partnered with an outstanding Company that was founded in 1872 in Japan and is headquartered in Tokyo. Our client employs approximately 72,000 employees at 733 locations, in 47 countries and 314 cities around the world.

They provide logistics solutions and comprehensive transportation services through its international freight forwarding and logistics network, including specialized handling of air, land, sea and express packages; all types and sizes of cargo; personal effects and household goods; fragile and perishable freight; and livestock. Also, they provide related services, such as warehousing, distribution and customs brokerage and clearance. Operates at 55 locations in 27 states within the U.S., with approximately 1300 employees. Our client has enjoyed tremendous growth and success as one of the top five international freight forwarders in the world. We connect people with products throughout the world.

Essential Duties:

  • Preparation of Import shipments and distribution of Import Documents
  • Coordination and communication with trucking companies, airlines, brokers, customers, steamship line and/or bonded facilities as well as with other branches and departments
  • Billing and Accounts Receivable

Technical:

  • Prepare Import shipments for assigned customers. This may include customs clearance, shipping, labeling, and distribution of cargo. Generate delivery orders and shipping labels as needed.
  • Prepare Import documents for distribution to brokerage department and/or Customers’ Broker
  • Coordinate pick up and delivery orders with trucking companies, airlines, steamship line and/or bonded facilities in order to obtain necessary information in order to process shipments in the best way.
  • Issue freight bills and invoices to brokers and responsible for collecting unpaid invoices within credit term

Minimum Requirements and Experience:

  • Approximately 1-2 years department of freight forwarding industry experience (Land, Sea and Air)
  • Analytical skill (Familiar with logistics concept and planning concept)
  • Knowledge of international commerce (Incoterms, method, customs regulations
  • Knowledge of Consolidator system
  • Must be able to accommodate a flexible work schedule including weekends and holidays as necessary

job.title: Project Manager
job.description:
• Location:Vernon, CA
  • Type:Direct Hire
  • Job#44909

Our Client is seeking a professional Project Manager with experience in the Food Manufacturing Industry. This is a Direct Hire Opportunity. The ideal candidate will is responsible for the development & commercialization of assigned projects.  

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Identify critical business needs, Go-to-Customer requirements, drive efficiencies in business processes and systems to ensure commercial success
  • Characterize, resolve, or escalate commercialization issues
  • Contributes to the cost analysis of the overall project
  • Responsible for leading minor and major projects from concept to commercialization
  • Manages multiple, and sometimes conflicting, priorities as well as multiple tasks/projects simultaneously while meeting company’s commitments including project deadlines, quality, budget, and customer expectations.
  • Effectively communicate program status or updates to leadership, prepare stage gate review information, facilitate stage gate approvals
  • Works with sales to complete any necessary customer onboarding paperwork
  • Coordinates the trials, first production runs and post review

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Experience in a food manufacturing or food processing environment.
  • Knowledge of TraceGains and/or Genesis 
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Food Science or related field, Biology, Chemistry OR equivalent experience and 4+ years of professional experience in Commercialization or Project Management roles
  • Must be able to manage multiple, and sometimes conflicting, priorities as well as multiple tasks/projects simultaneously while meeting company’s commitments including project deadlines, quality, budget, and customer expectations.
  • Advanced computer skills in Excel, PowerPoint, MS Project, Visio, etc.
  • Must be available to travel (minimal need)

SCHEDULE: M-F 8am-5pm (On Site)
SALARY: $85K – $95K

job.title: Inbound Associate – Equipment Operator
job.description:
• Location:Grove City, OH
  • Type:Contract to Hire
  • Job#44911

This position encompasses the receiving of incoming product in accordance with company operational and quality procedures.  Duties include the unloading, receiving, put-away, and replenishing of product/material within the warehouse facility.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Follow safety guidelines of the Inbound department and general warehouse standards
  • Operate mobile equipment per safety guidelines and requirements
  • Unloading of product / material from trailer to warehouse facility
  • Properly receive product / material and maintain required documentation via paper or electronically
  • Accurately place product / material in warehouse storage locations
  • Replenishing of product / material at pick locations in a timely and accurate manner
  • Verify product / material items and counts
  • Allocating space to store material and maximize storage
  • Reporting of any non-conformance/compliance issues to the Inbound Team Lead or Inbound ADM
  • Observe all company rules and regulations

REQUIREMENTS:

  • High school diploma or equivalent is preferred
  • Prior warehouse experience preferred
  • Ability to frequently lift up to 50 lbs
  • Certification or ability to be certified in mobile equipment (fork-truck, stand up fork-truck, etc)
  • Attention to detail of alpha and numerical data
  • Time management and ability to work independently

job.title: Warehouse Supervisor
job.description:
• Location:Grove City, OH
  • Type:Contract to Hire
  • Job#44912

This position encompasses the oversight of receiving and shipping of product/material in accordance with company operational and quality procedures. This includes the proper stocking of received product materiel within the warehouse pick locations

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Business Prioritization / Status
  • Coordinate and supervise inbound / outbound product shipments
  • Daily focus on Load Ready Day Time (LRDT) targets
  • Maintain alignment of shipping activities with daily goals
  • Monitor the capacity of shipping process
  • Support customer service standards
  • Investigate and resolve any shipping issues
  • Monitor Picker Productivity
  • Daily / Weekly review of performance versus KPI
  • Implement countermeasures to address any performance gaps
  • Support implementation of Process Improvements / Pick Optimization
  • Participate or lead training initiatives for team members
  • Leadership and Guidance
  • Deliver coaching and development to Workflow and Shipping coordinators
  • Facilitate team communication/support of KPI targets
  • Provide timely and relevant performance feedback to team members
  • Engage in problem solving of systemic issues
  • Report and oversee resolution of non-conforming product
  • Evaluate and implement info systems improvements
  • Analyze and make recommendations for overstock, transfers, sales forecast and maintaining the forecast
  • Analyze Inventory processes to make improvements for most accurate counts.
  • Participate in ISO9000 activities

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Prefer associate degree (preferably in Supply Chain Management or a related field)
  • Minimum of 2 years of supervisory experience in a warehouse environment with ability to lead and motivate others
  • Minimum of 5 years’ experience in distribution and/or production work environment
  • Knowledge and operational experience with Warehouse Management System (WMS) and Labor Management System (LMS)
  • Must be proficient in MS Word and Excel
  • Knowledge of OSHA safety requirements for warehouse environment
  • Certification in Fork Truck / Mobile Equipment operation
  • Background in materials, quality, or supply chain management a plus

job.title: Quality Control Manager
job.description:
• Location:Vernon, CA
  • Type:Direct Hire
  • Job#44817

Resource Employment Solutions is seeking a professional Quality Control Manager. The ideal candidate will be responsible for monitoring and ensuring plant products are safe and meet customer specifications and company quality and reliability standards.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Monitor & oversee supervisor performance to ensure tasks have been performed during daily needs.
  • Lead as a HACCP Coordinator at the plant to oversee all food safety-related conditions and all HACCP-related activities that include but are not limited to HACPP meetings, HACCP reassessment, and HACCP plan review.
  • Handle, Coordinate, Monitor and respond to customer complaints.
  • Responsible for trend analysis on food safety and quality related data that includes KPI, micro performance at the plant for environmental swabs, material and finished product.
  • Handle interview and train new hires, ongoing training for all the QC Technician employees for food safety and quality related activities at a minimum of once annually.
  • Liaison as a led contact to plant USDA Inspector to coordinate, handle and response of any regulatory issues/concerns/opportunities and inquiry.

REQUIREMENTS:

  • 5-10 years in USDA/FDA background in a Food Manufacturing or Pharmaceutical,
  • Nutraceutical industry
  • 2-3 years’ experience in a Managerial and Compliance role.
  • Bachelor’s degree in science, preferably in Food Science and Technology.
  • Bi-lingual in Spanish is a plus
  • Excellent leadership skills.
  • Strong Microsoft Office skills

SHIFT:

  • First shift
  • Monday- Friday
  • 7:30am to 4:30 pm

Remote is not optional.
